title: Production and Operation Management; Project Management
headline: Learn PERT and CPM in network analysis including future of production and operations management in this online course
description: This free online Production & Operation project management training course will teach you about the tools in project management, including network analysis using program evaluation review technique and the critical path method. You will learn about the focused manufacturing step in the scheduling process, as well as the use of Gantt charts. The course will also teach you about the future direction of production and operations management.
courseDescription:
In this course, you will be introduced to the concept of project management training, as well as the main tools that are used to carry out project management processes. The ways to perform network analysis using program evaluation review technique (PERT) and critical path method (CPM) will also be covered in this course. Then, this course will also teach you how to perform probabilistic time estimates, carry out proactive maintenance, as well as the life cycle of any equipment.

This course will also introduce you to the focused manufacturing step in the scheduling process, as well as the use of Gantt charts in the scheduling process. Furthermore, this course will cover the various order sequencing rules and problems, as well as an introduction to work method analysis. Lastly, this training course will teach you about work management in project management training, as well as the future direction of production and operations management.

This training course is helpful for learners who want to gain an understanding of the concept and tools that are important in the project management process. The course is also helpful for learners who are aiming to carry out accurate scheduling processes in manufacturing and the order sequencing rules applied. Begin this course now to learn how program evaluation review technique (PERT) and critical path method (CPM) is applied in project management.
